Amulet of the Planes.description:
Amulet of the Planes

Anyone looking closely at this black circular amulet sees a dark, moving, swirl of colors. The wearer can use the amulet to cast major @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{Plane Shift} once per day, but it is a difficult item to master.

The user makes a Smarts −2 roll to make the amulet take her to the plane (and the specific location on that plane) she wants. If she fails, roll a die. Odd, the amulet transports her and all those who have linked hands with her to a random location on that plane. Even, it takes her to a random @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{plane} .

Bag of Holding, Major.name: Bag of Holding, Major
Bag of Holding, Major.description:
BAG OF HOLDING

This common-looking cloth sack is about 2’ by 4’ in size, but inside it opens into a vast nondimensional space. Whatever is put into the bag, it weighs a fixed amount. This weight, and the limits in weight and volume of the bag’s contents, depend on the bag’s type, as shown on the table below.

If overloaded, the bag of holding and all of its contents are destroyed and lost, forever. Likewise, if the bag is ruptured, it and all its contents are destroyed. The bag’s owner can sense the volume used, making it possible to manage the space without accidentally destroying it or its contents.

Storing or retrieving an item from the bag requires an action. Lifeforms put into the bag can live for 10 minutes before being @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated}.

Ballista.description:
A ballista is a mechanical engine designed to fire a massive crossbow bolt. One person can fire the device@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{(Shooting)}. One person can reload, although it’s faster with two people.

Banded Mail of Luck.name: Banded Mail of Luck
Banded Mail of Luck.description:
Banded Mail of Luck

Ten 100-gp gems adorn this banded plate mail corselet (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06enchantments00]{Aegis}). Once per encounter, the wearer may force a foe to reroll a successful attack roll made against him. The wearer chooses which result is kept. The attacker may still benefit from any additional @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{rerolls}.

Price: 18,900 gp. Weight: 35 lbs.

Craft: Good aligned, 9,650 gp.

Belt of Dwarvenkind.name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
Belt of Dwarvenkind.description:
Belt of Dwarvenkind

This belt gives the wearer +2 to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} checks when dealing with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Dwarf]{dwarves}, +1 with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Gnome]{gnomes} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Halfling]{halflings}, and −1 with anyone else.

The wearer can also understand, speak, and read Dwarven. If the wearer is not a dwarf, he gains darkvision 10”.

Price: 14,900 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: Dwarf, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{Speak Language}; 7,450 gp.

Belt of Physical Might, Major.name: Belt of Physical Might, Major
Belt of Physical Might, Major.description:
BELT of Physical Might

The golden buckle of this belt depicts a fearsome animal. The wearer’s Agility, Strength, or Vigor is increased one die type (minor) or two die types (major), as long as it’s worn. The attribute is chosen at creation or rolled randomly if found.

Price: 16,000 gp (minor) or 36,000 (major); Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost Trait}; 8,000 gp (minor), 18,000 (major).

Boots of Elvenkind.name: Boots of Elvenkind
Boots of Elvenkind.description:
Boots of elvenkind

These soft boots grants the wearer a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Reroll} on all @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Stealth]{Stealth} checks.

Price: 2,500 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Elf]{Elf}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility}; 1,250 gp.

Boots of Levitation.name: Boots of Levitation
Boots of Levitation.description:
Boots of Levitation

These soft leather boots are incredibly light and comfortable, with thin soles reinforced by strips of tough hide that provide an unexpected amount of support and protection. On command, they grant the wearer minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly}, but only move up or down!

Price: 7,500 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly}; 3,750 gp.

Boots of Speed.name: Boots of Speed
Boots of Speed.description:
Boots of SPEED

Three times per day the wearer can click her heels together (a limited free action) to gain the benefits of minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sloth/Speed]{Speed} with the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Quickness modifier}.

Price: 12,000 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speed]{Speed}; 6,000 gp.

Boots of Striding and Springing.name: Boots of Striding and Springing
Boots of Striding and Springing.description:
Boots of Striding and Springing

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Boots of Striding and Springing]{See item here}

These boots increase the wearer’s Pace by 2, and add +2 to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (jumping) rolls.

Price: 5,500 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sloth/Speed]{Speed}; 2,750 gp.

Boots, Winged.name: Boots, Winged
Boots, Winged.description:
Boots, Winged

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Boots, Winged]{See item here}

On command, these ordinary looking boots sprout wings from the heels to grant the wearer the minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly} power. He can fly three per times day for up to five minutes per flight.

Price: 16,000 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly}; 8,000 gp.

Bottle of Air.name: Bottle of Air
Bottle of Air.description:
Bottle of Air

When taken to any airless environment, this corked glass bottle retains air within. Anyone who holds it can breathe from it as an action.

Price: 7,250 gp; Weight: 2 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{Environmental Protection}; 3,625 gp.

Bracelet of Friends.name: Bracelet of Friends
Bracelet of Friends.description:
Bracelet of Friends

This silver bracelet has four charms. The owner may designate one person known to him to be keyed to each charm. When a charm is grasped and the name of the keyed individual is spoken, that person is called to the spot along with his gear (this fails if the target is on a different @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{plane}).

The target knows who is calling, and the bracelet of friends only functions on willing travelers. Once a charm is activated, it disappears. Charms separated from the bracelet are worthless.

Price: 19,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{Teleport}; 9,500 gp.

Bracers of Armor, Major.name: Bracers of Armor, Major
Bracers of Armor, Major.description:
Bracers OF armor

These wrist or arm guards surround the wearer with an invisible but tangible field of force. They grant an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{armor} bonus of +2 (minor) or +4 (major), which does not stack with worn armor (use the highest value). The bracers can be freely used regardless of Armor Interference or Armor Restriction.

Price: 16,000 gp (minor), 36,000 (major); Weight: 1.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{Protection}; 8,000 gp (minor), 18,000 (major).

Caltrops.name: Caltrops
Caltrops.description: Notes: One batch covers a Small Blast Template, two a Medium, and three a Large. Counts as Difficult Ground; anyone moving through the area must make an @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} roll or be @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure} causes a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} to the feet (–2 Pace until healed).
Caltrops.notes: 1x batch covers SBT, 2x for MBT, 3x for LBT, Difficult Ground Athletics roll or Shaken, Crit Failure causes Wound.

Candle of Truth.name: Candle of Truth
Candle of Truth.description:
Candle of Truth

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Candle of Truth]{See item here}

This white tallow candle burns for no more than one hour. When alight, it creates a zone of truth in a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Medium Blast Template}. Anyone within must tell the truth unless they pass a Spirit check at −4. If the candle is snuffed before the hour ends, the effect is canceled and the candle ruined.

Price: 2,500 gp; Weight: 1/2 lb.

Craft: 1,250 gp.

Cannon.name: Cannon
Cannon.description:
Solid Shot: Heavy balls of iron, lead, or stone designed to batter walls or plow through packed ranks of troops. To fire, the leader of the crew makes a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Shooting} roll as usual. If successful, roll a die. If even, it bounces to another victim behind and within 6” of the first and hits him as well. Continue in this way until the die roll is odd.

Bombard: Assuming they have a rough idea of their target’s location, bombards may fire at targets they cannot see by lobbing projectiles over intervening terrain or obstacles. Bombarding suffers a -4 penalty in addition to all other modifiers, and doubles deviation when the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Shooting} roll is failed see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Area Effect Attacks}. Reduce the penalty to -2 with precise coordinates (such as from a skilled spotter).
Cannon.notes: MBT Blast, Reload 8, Heavy Weapon, Two crew members may reload at the same time

Cape of Montebank.name: Cape of Montebank
Cape of Montebank.description:
Cape of the Mountebank

On command, as a limited action, this bright red and gold cape allows the wearer to use minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{Teleport} once per day. When he disappears, he leaves behind a cloud of smoke, appearing in a similar fashion at his destination.

Price: 10,800 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{Teleport}; 5,400 gp.

Carpet of Flying, Large.name: Carpet of Flying, Large
Carpet of Flying, Large.description:
Carpet of Flying

This beautiful and intricate rug is able to fly through the air as if affected by a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly} spell of unlimited duration. The size, carrying capacity, and speed of the different carpets are shown on the table below.

Each carpet has its own command word that activates it. If the device is within voice range, the command word activates it, whether the speaker is on the rug or not. The carpet is then controlled by spoken directions and the Piloting skill.

A flying carpet can carry up to double its capacity, but doing so reduces it to Pace 6.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly}; 10,000 gp (small), 30,000 (large).

Catapult.description:

Firing can be done by a single person, but loading the projectile takes at least four.

Chime of Opening.description:
Chime of Opening

A chime of opening is a foot long hollow mithral tube. It can be pointed at a container, door, or gate and struck, sending forth magical vibrations that cause locks, lids, doors, valves, and portals to open. The device functions against normal bars, shackles, chains, bolts, and so on, but only opens one form of lock at a time.

A chime of opening also automatically @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{dispels} powers locking these portals. A chime can be used a total of 10 times before it cracks and becomes useless.

Cloak of Displacement

Cloak OF Etherealness

Decanter of Endless Water.name: Decanter of Endless Water
Decanter of Endless Water.description:
Decanter of Endless Water

Remove the stopper from this ordinary-looking flask and speak a command word to generate fresh or salt water. Separate command words determine the type of water as well as the volume and velocity.

  • “Stream” pours out one gallon per round.
  • “Fountain” produces a five foot long stream at 5 gallons per round.
  • “Geyser” produces a 20 foot long, one foot wide stream at 30 gallons per round.

The geyser effect can be used to Push a foe of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} 2 or less. This requires no attack roll, but both the wielder of the decanter and the target must make a Strength roll at −2 or be knocked prone and pushed back 1d6”. (This has no effect on creatures of Size 4 or larger.)

The command must be spoken to stop it.

Craft: 4,500 gp.

Dimensional Shackles.description:
Dimensional Shackles

These shackles have golden runes traced across their cold iron links. Any creature bound within them cannot use @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{Plane Shift} or any ability that allows them to leave their current plane of existence. They fit any Small to Large creature.

Dust of Appearance.description:
Dust OF appearance

This fine metallic powder is stored in small silk packets or stoppered ceramic tubes. When the user scatters the dust into the air, it coats everything in a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Medium Blast Template}. Invisible creatures become visible, stealth checks made by affected creatures are made at −4, and all illusions within are @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{dispelled}.

A packet or tube of dust provides one use.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{Detect Arcana}; 900 gp.

Dust of Disappearance.name: Dust of Disappearance
Dust of Disappearance.description:
DUST of DISAPPEARANCE

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Dust of Disappearance]{See item here}

This dust looks like dust of appearance and is typically stored in the same manner.

Sprinkling it on a creature or object causes it to become invisible, even to those with magical detection abilities such as @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{Detect Arcana}. Only dust of appearance counters dust of disappearance.

Dust of disappearance lasts 2d6 rounds, rolled by the Game Master— the user never knows when the Duration will expire!

Price: 3,500 gp; Weight: —.

Efficient Quiver.description:
Efficient Quiver

The second, slightly longer compartment holds up to 18 javelin sized objects. The third and longest portion of the case contains as many as six bow sized objects (spears, staves, or the like).

The quiver can quickly produce any stored item the wearer desires as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Free Action}.

Price: 1,800 gp; Weight: 2 lbs.

ELIXIR OF Fire Breath

This strange bubbling elixir bestows the ability to spit gouts of flame. The user can breathe fire as a limited action up to three times after drinking the elixir, dealing 3d6 fire damage in a Cone Template. This can be Evaded.

Unused blasts dissipate one hour after the liquid is consumed.

Price: 1,100 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burst]{Burst}; 550 gp.

Everburning Torch.description: Notes: A "torch" permanently enchanted with light. It does not burn and emits no heat.

Eyes of the Eagle

Figurine of Wondrous Power

Each of the several kinds of figurines of wondrous power is a miniature statuette of a creature an inch or so high (with one exception). Flame Toungue.name: Flame Toungue
Flame Toungue.description:
Flame Tongue

The wielder of this @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sword, Long]{Longsword} can cause it to burst into flame as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Free Actions}. When it does so, it causes +1 damage and can cast a flaming @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}, AP 2, as an action once per day (using @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} as the casting roll).

Price: 20,715 gp. Weight: 4 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}; 10,515 gp.

Gauntlet of Rust.name: Gauntlet of Rust
Gauntlet of Rust.description:
Gauntlet of Rust

This single metal gauntlet looks rusted and pitted but is actually quite powerful. Once per day, it can cause a non-magical object (or a three-foot radius of the object) made of iron or iron alloy to crumble into rust.

It also completely protects the wearer and her gear from rust (magical or otherwise), including the attack of a rust monster.

Cost: 11,500 gp; Weight: 2 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}; 5,750 gp.

Gauntlet, locked.name: Gauntlet, locked
Gauntlet, locked.description: +1 to Strength roll against Disarm. (Chains and braces, requires an action to fasten/release)

Gloves of Storing.name: Gloves of Storing
Gloves of Storing.description:
GLOVES OF Storing

On command, one item held in a hand wearing the glove disappears. The item can weigh no more than 20 pounds and must be able to be held in one hand. While stored, the item has negligible weight.

With a snap of the gloved fingers, the item reappears. A glove can only store one item at a time, and storing or retrieving it is a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Free Action}.

Price: 10,000 gp (one glove); Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Growth/Shrink]{Shrink}; 5,000 gp.

Gloves of Swimming and Climbing.name: Gloves of Swimming and Climbing
Gloves of Swimming and Climbing.description:
GLOVES OF SWIMMING AND CLIMBING

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Gloves of Swimming and Climbing]{See item here}

These supple leather gloves grant +2 to all Athletics (climbing, swimming) checks.

Price: 6,250 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost}; 3,125 gp.

Goggles of Night.name: Goggles of Night
Goggles of Night.description:
Goggles of Night

The lenses of these goggles are made of dark opaque, crystal. The wearer can see through them regardless and gains @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Darkvision]{Darkvision} up to 10” (20 yards).

Price: 12,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Darksight]{Darksight}; 6,000 gp.

Hand of Glory.name: Hand of Glory
Hand of Glory.description:
Hand of Glory

This mummified human hand hangs by a leather cord around a character’s neck (taking up space as a magic necklace). If a magic ring is placed on one of the fingers of the hand, the wearer benefits from it as if wearing it herself, and it does not count against her two-ring limit.

The hand can wear only one ring at a time. Even without a ring, the hand allows its wearer to use minor light and minor detect arcana each once per day.

Price: 8,000 gp; Weight: 2 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{Detect Arcana}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{Light}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{Zombie}; 4,000 gp.

Hand of the Mage.name: Hand of the Mage
Hand of the Mage.description:
Hand of the Mage

This mummified elf hand hangs by a golden chain around the character’s neck (taking up space as a magic necklace). It allows the wearer to manipulate objects of up to 5 lbs within 5” (10 yards).

Price: 900 gp; Weight: 2 lbs.

Craft: 450 gp.

Handy Haversack.name: Handy Haversack
Handy Haversack.description:
HANDY HAVERSACK

This backpack is constructed of finely tanned, worn leather with brass hardware and buckles. It has one main compartment and two side pouches. Similar to a bag of holding, all three pouches access an extra-dimensional space.

The main compartment holds up to eight cubic feet in volume or 80 pounds of material. The side pouches hold two cubic feet or 20 pounds of weight. Regardless of how of much is carried in the haversack, it always weighs five pounds.

The bearer can reach into the compartments or pouches for a specific item and find it on top and available as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited free action}.

Price: 2,000 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Growth/Shrink]{Growth/Shrink}; 1,000 gp.

Harp of Charming.name: Harp of Charming
Harp of Charming.description:
Harp of Charming

Every 10 minutes played, the player of this beautiful and ornate harp may make a Performance roll to cast the minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Puppet]{Puppet} power.

If any Performance roll fails, no one in the audience can be affected the harp for 24 hours.

Price: 7,500 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Puppet]{Puppet};3,750 gp.

Hat of Disguise.name: Hat of Disguise
Hat of Disguise.description:
HAT OF DISGUISE

This normal-looking felt hat grants the wearer minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{Disguise} three times per day.

Price: 1,800; Weight: –.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{Disguise}; 900 gp.

Headband of Mental Prowess, Major.name: Headband of Mental Prowess, Major
Headband of Mental Prowess, Major.description:
Headband of Mental Prowess

A yellow gem is set in the center of this simple copper headband, much like a third eye. It increases the wearer’s Smarts or Spirit one die type (minor) or two die types (major), chosen at creation, or rolled randomly if found.

Price: 16,000 gp (minor) or 36,000 (major); Weight: 1.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost Trait}; 8,000 gp (minor), 18,000 (major).

Numerous small white gemstones decorate this ornate headband. It increases the wearer’s Smarts and Spirit increased one die type (minor) or two die types (major).

Price: 40,000 gp (minor), 90,000 (major); Weight: 1.

Helm of Comprehend Languages.description:
Helm of Comprehend Languages

Helm of Teleportation.name: Helm of Teleportation
Helm of Teleportation.description:
Helm of Teleportation

As a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited action}, a character wearing this helm may @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{teleport} (major) with the Greater Teleport @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifier} three times per day.

Price: 73,500 gp. Weight: 3 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{Teleport}; 36,750 gp.

Holy Avenger.name: Holy Avenger
Holy Avenger.description:
Holy Avenger

This iron @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sword, Long]{Longsword} (Str+d10, AP 2) adds +1 to its user’s Fighting rolls (+2 if wielded by a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Paladin]{paladin}). A paladin also gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Arcane Resistance]{Arcane Resistance} Edge, and may cast @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{Dispel} using @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} as an action three times per encounter.

Price: 120,630 gp. Weight: 4lbs.

Craft: Good aligned; 60,630 gp.

Holy Water.name: Holy Water
Holy Water.description: Notes: Holy water can be thrown in a flask or splashed on an adjacent creature. Undead and certain evil creatures (GM's call) within the template take 2d4 damage when hit and 2d4–2 damage at the start of their next turn.

Horseshoes of Speed.description:
Horseshoes of Speed

When affixed to an animal’s hooves, these horseshoes increase the animal’s base Pace by 6. All four shoes must be worn by the same animal to be effective.

Price: 3,000 gp; Weight: 12 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sloth/Speed]{Speed}; 1,500 gp.

Immovable Rod.name: Immovable Rod
Immovable Rod.description:
Immovable Rod

This rod looks like a flat iron bar with a small button on one end. When the button is pushed (a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action}), the rod does not move from where it is, even if staying in place defies gravity. The owner can lift or place the rod wherever he wishes, push the button, and let go.

An immovable rod can support up to 8,000 pounds before falling to the ground. If a creature pushes against an immovable rod, it must make a Strength check at −4 to move the rod up to 2” (4 yards) in a single round.

Price: 5,000 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: 2,500 gp.

Improvised Weapon (Heavy).name: Improvised Weapon (Heavy)
Improvised Weapon (Heavy).description:
Improvised Weapons

Heroes often fight with objects that aren’t intended for use as weapons. Torches, vases, chairs, tankards, bottles, tools, and other mundane items are frequently pressed into service in combat.

Characters with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{improvised weapons} count as armed but subtract 2 from attack rolls. Range, damage and Minimum Strength are determined by type:

  • Light: Beer stein, fist-sized rock, dagger pommel (as a club). Range 3/6/12, Damage Str+d4, Min Str d4.
  • Medium: Hammer, pick, wooden chair. Range 2/4/8, Damage Str+d6, Min. Str d6.
  • Heavy: Head-size rock, sack of stones, log. Range 1/2/4, Damage Str+d8, Min. Str d8.

The GM should adjust the damage and other factors as makes sense for the particular item.

Javelin of Lightning.description:
Javelin of Lightning

When thrown, the javelin becomes a streak of lightning. The user places a Stream Template in front of himself. The attack does 4d6 electricity damage to anyone who fails to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{evade}. The javelin is consumed in the attack.

Price: 1,500 gp; Weight: 2 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}; 750 gp.

Lance.name: Lance
Lance.description: @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{AP} 2 when charging, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Reach} 2, only usable in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{mounted combat}
Lance.notes: AP 2 when charging. Only usable in mounted combat

Lantern of Revealing.name: Lantern of Revealing
Lantern of Revealing.description:
Lantern of Revealing

This hooded lantern reveals all invisible creatures and objects within 5”(10 yards) when lit.

Price: 30,000 gp; Weight: 2 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{Detect Arcana}; 15,000 gp.

Lion Shield.name: Lion Shield
Lion Shield.description:
Lion shield

The face of this heavy steel @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Heavy Shield (-1 Pace)]{shield} (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06enchantments00]{Deflecting}) is fashioned as a roaring lion’s head. Three times per day as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited free action}, the lion’s head can be commanded to bite. It attacks with the wielder’s @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} and causes 2d8, AP 2 damage.

Price: 9,170 gp. Weight: 15 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{Summon Ally}, 4,670 gp.

Luck Blade.name: Luck Blade
Luck Blade.description:
Luck blade

This plain-looking @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sword, Short]{Short Sword} grants the wielder the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Luck]{Luck} Edge. Some luck blades may contain d4−1 wishes! (GM’s call.) The user should never know how many are left, and once used, the wishes are gone forever. (See @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish}.)

Price: 22,060 gp (0 wishes), 62,360 (1 wish), 102,660 gp (2 wishes),142,960 gp (3 wishes); Weight: 2 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish}; 11,185 gp (0 wishes), 43,835 (1 wish), 76,485 gp (2 wishes),109,135gp (3 wishes).

Manual of Attribute Increase.name: Manual of Attribute Increase
Manual of Attribute Increase.description:
Manual of attribute increase

Reading this arcane treatise permanently increases an attribute (chosen at creation) one die type. It takes a full week of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04downtime000000]{Downtime} to read the manual and reap its rewards. Once read, the book’s magical writing fades.

A single character may only ever increase one attribute via a manual of attribute increase.

Price: 82,000 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish}; 41,000 gp.
Manual of Attribute Increase.notes: Once read, keep this item equipped. It can never be sold or traded away as it was consumed during the reading. However, it keep the stat it granted you must keep it equipped.

Maul.name: Maul
Maul.notes: Two Hands. +2 damage to break objects

Natural Bite.name: Natural Bite
Natural Bite.description: BITE: The creature may bite a target it’s grappled (most attackers can only crush their prey, see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Grappling}).

Natural Claws.name: Natural Claws
Natural Claws.description: CLAWS: +2 to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (climbing) rolls on any rough or soft surface (not sheer steel, glass, etc.).

Natural Horns.name: Natural Horns
Natural Horns.description: HORNS: Add +4 @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Damage} at the end of one @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} action in which it @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Runs}, moves at least 5″(10 yards), and successfully hits with its horns.

Necklace of Fireballs, Major.name: Necklace of Fireballs, Major
Necklace of Fireballs, Major.description:
Necklace OF fireballs

This item appears to be a string of beads, usually tied together like a necklace. The wearer understands its true form, however, a gold chain with a number of gold spheres of two different sizes. The necklace holds three of each size sphere when created.

As a limited action, the wearer can detach and throw a sphere, placing a blast template up to 10" away. The small spheres explode with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{blast} in a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Small Blast Template}. The large spheres explode with blast in a Large Blast Template. The blasts can be @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Evaded}. The sphere is consumed when used.

The sphere’s power are determined at creation (minor or major blast).

The necklace is Hardness 10. If it's ever shattered by a magical fire attack, all remaining beads detonate at once! Resolve each blast separately.

Price: 2,700 gp (minor), 5,400 (major); Weight: 1.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{Blast};1,350 gp (minor), 2,700 (major).

Oathbow.name: Oathbow
Oathbow.description:
Oathbow

This elvencraft @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Bow (composite)]{composite longbow)} (+1 Shooting) whispers “Swift defeat to my enemies” in Elven when pulled. Once per day, the archer can swear aloud to slay a specific target (in Elvish). The bow responds “Death to those who have wronged me!” Attacking that target with the bow causes +d6 damage and the user gets a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{reroll} on his @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll.

The oathbow may only have one sworn enemy at a time. Once the wielder swears to slay a target, he cannot make a new oath until the target is slain or seven days have passed.

Price: 25,600 gp; Weight: 3lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Elf]{Elf}; 13,100 gp.

Pearl of Power, Novice.name: Pearl of Power, Novice
Pearl of Power, Novice.description:
Pearl OF power

Average in size and luster, this pearl allows the bearer to recast any one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powersummari00]{power} they’ve already cast that day (including any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers}). The user must still make a skill roll to cast the power, but pays no Power Points.

The pearl only allows powers of the determined Rank or lower to be recast.

Price: 16,000 gp (Novice), 36,000 gp (Seasoned), or 64,000 (Veteran);

Weight: –.

Pearl of the Sirens

The beautiful pearl (value of at least 1,000 gp) enables its possessor to breathe in water as if she were in clean, fresh air. Her swim Pace is 9 and she can cast spells and act underwater without hindrance.

Price: 15,300 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{Environmental Protection}; 8,150 gp.

Periapt of Health.name: Periapt of Health
Periapt of Health.description:
Periapt of Health

The wearer of this necklace, a blue gem on a silver chain, is immune to disease, including supernatural diseases.

Price: 7,500 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{Healing}; 3,750 gp.

Periapt of Proof Against Poison.name: Periapt of Proof Against Poison
Periapt of Proof Against Poison.description:
Periapt of Proof Against Poison

This necklace features a brilliant-cut black gem on a silver chain. The wearer is immune to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{Poison}, though poisons active when the periapt is first donned still run their course.

Price: 27,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{Healing}; 13,500 gp.

Pony, heavy.description: See @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Horse, Heavy]{Horse, Heavy} for more details.

Pony, light.description: See @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Horse, Light]{Horse, Light} for more details.

Portable Hole.name: Portable Hole
Portable Hole.description:
Portable Hole

A portable hole is a circle of cloth spun from the webs of a phase spider interwoven with strands of ether and beams of starlight, resulting in a portable, extradimensional space.

The portable hole is two yards in diameter when unfolded, but the user can fold it to become as small as a pocket handkerchief. When fully opened, it accesses an extra-dimensional hole four yards deep. This hole can be picked up from inside or out by simply taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Either way, the entrance disappears, but anything inside the hole remains, traveling with the item.

It contains enough air for one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08sizetable00000]{Size} 0 creature for 10 minutes.

Price: 20,000 gp; Weight: – lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{Plane Shift}; 10,000 gp.

Potion of Damage Field w/Damage.name: Potion of Damage Field w/Damage
Potion of Damage Field w/Damage.description:
See power: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Damage Field]{Damage Field}

Potions are alchemical concoctions enchanted with arcane energies. Drinking the potion (an action) activates the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000001]{power} contained within immediately. Each potion can only contain one power, and each potion contains only one dose.

An individual can only benefit from one potion per round. If given more than one, roll randomly to see which one takes effect—all others are wasted.

A potion can be administered to an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated} or unconscious person (as an action).

Craft: The crafting cost of a minor potion is equal to its @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000001]{power’s} Rank × the number of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} it uses; then multiply that total by 25 gp. A major potion doubles the final result (For example, a potion of minor healing without any modifiers is Novice (1) × 3 power point × 25 gp = 75 gp). A potion's market price is double their cost to craft

This ring grants the wearer a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Reroll} on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Evasion} rolls.

Price: 25,000; Weight: —.

Craft: 12,500 gp.
Ring of Evasion.notes: This ring grants the wearer a free reroll on Evasion rolls.

Ring of Feather Falling.name: Ring of Feather Falling
Ring of Feather Falling.description:
Ring of Feather Falling

The wearer treats any fall as if it were no more than two yards in height.

Price: 2,200 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 1,100 gp.
Ring of Feather Falling.notes: The wearer treats any fall as if it were no more than two yards in height.

Ring of Invisibility.name: Ring of Invisibility
Ring of Invisibility.description:
RING OF INVISIBILITY

The wearer gains major @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility} with the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} modifier. The wearer can take the ring off and put it back on to reactivate the power.

Price: 20,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{Invisibility}; 10,000 gp.
Ring of Invisibility.notes: -6 to be hit and Noticed for 5 minutes. Can take the ring off and put it back on to reactivate.

Ring of Protection, Major.name: Ring of Protection, Major
Ring of Protection, Major.description:
Ring of Protection

This ring offers continual magical defense in the form of minor or major @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{Protection}. Note that this doesn’t stack with the Protection spell.

Price: 4,000 gp (Minor), 10,000 gp (Major); Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{Protection}; 2,000 gp (Minor), 5,000 (Major).

Ring of Protection, Minor.name: Ring of Protection, Minor
Ring of Protection, Minor.description:
Ring of Protection

This ring offers continual magical defense in the form of minor or major @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{Protection}. Note that this doesn’t stack with the Protection spell.

Price: 4,000 gp (Minor), 10,000 gp (Major); Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{Protection}; 2,000 gp (Minor), 5,000 (Major).

Ring of Regeneration.name: Ring of Regeneration
Ring of Regeneration.description:
Ring of Regeneration

When worn, the wearer may attempt a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{Natural Healing} roll once per day. This can even regrow limbs or organs if they’ve been severed or lost.

The ring has no effect on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds} taken before it was worn.

Price: 90,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 45,000 gp.
Ring of Regeneration.notes: When worn, the wearer may attempt a natural healing roll once per day. This can even regrow limbs or organs if they’ve been severed or lost. The ring has no effect on Wounds taken before it was worn.

Ring of Spell Storing.name: Ring of Spell Storing
Ring of Spell Storing.description:
Ring of Spell Storing

This ring can have a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powersummari00]{single power} cast upon it at a time. As an action, the wearer can invoke the spell held within, allowing one chance to cast it with an arcane skill of d12 (as if cast by a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Wild Card}). The spell’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} cannot be extended or maintained.

Price: 18,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 9,000 gp.
Ring of Spell Storing.notes: This ring can have a single power cast upon it at a time. As an action, the wearer can invoke the spell held within, allowing one chance to cast it with an arcane skill of d12 (as if cast by a Wild Card).

Ring of Sustenance.name: Ring of Sustenance
Ring of Sustenance.description:
Ring of Sustenance

After a full week of being worn, this ring provides its wearer with life-sustaining @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{nourishment}. It also refreshes the body and mind, so its wearer need only @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{sleep} two hours per day to gain the benefit of eight hours.

If the ring is removed, the owner must wear it for another week to re-attune it to himself.

Price: 2,500 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 1,250 gp.
Ring of Sustenance.notes: After a full week of being worn, this ring provides its wearer with life-sustaining nourishment. It also refreshes the body and mind, so its wearer need only sleep two hours per day to gain the benefit of eight hours. If the ring is removed, the owner must wear it for another week to re-attune it to himself.

Ring of Telekinesis.name: Ring of Telekinesis
Ring of Telekinesis.description:
Ring of Telekinesis

This ring grants the wearer minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Telekinesis]{telekinesis}.

Price: 75,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Telekinesis]{Telekinesis}; 37,500 gp.
Ring of Telekinesis.notes: Range Smarts x2 mentally move objects or creatures with a Strength d10 and moved Smarts per turn. Unwilling targets resist with opposed Spirit roll.

Ring of Three Wishes.name: Ring of Three Wishes
Ring of Three Wishes.description:
Ring of Three Wishes

This ring is set with three rubies. Each ruby stores a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish}. When a wish is used, that ruby crumbles to dust. When all wishes are used, the ring is no longer magical.

Price: 120,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish}; 97,500 gp.
Ring of Three Wishes.notes: Three rubies hold three wishes, each destroyed when a wish is used.

Ring of Water Walking.name: Ring of Water Walking
Ring of Water Walking.description:
Ring of Water Walking

Often made of coral or bluish metal decorated with wave motifs, this ring allows the wearer to walk across any liquid as if it were firm ground.

Price: 15,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 7,500 gp.
Ring of Water Walking.notes: This ring allows the wearer to walk across any liquid as if it were firm ground.

Ring of the Ram.name: Ring of the Ram
Ring of the Ram.description:
Ring of the Ram

As a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited actions}, the wearer can command the ring to manifest a barely discernible ram-like force to batter foes. The force strikes a single target, dealing 1d6 damage per charge, up to a maximum of 3 charges per use. This has a range of 10” (20 yards). Anyone struck by the ram is knocked back 2d6” (creatures of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} 3 or more are immune to the latter effect).

A newly created ring has 25 charges. When all the charges are expended, the ring becomes a nonmagical item.

Price: 8,600 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost Trait} ; 4,300 gp.
Ring of the Ram.notes: As a limited action, force strikes a single target, dealing 1d6 damage per charge, up to a maximum of 3 charges per use. This has a range of 10” (20 yards). Anyone struck by the ram is knocked back 2d6". Size 3+ immune and 25 charges.

Ring of the Skillful.name: Ring of the Skillful
Ring of the Skillful.description:
Ring of the Skillful

The ring grants a +1 bonus to a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{single skill}, chosen at creation. The bonus does not affect attack rolls or rolls to activate powers.

Price: 10,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 5,000 gp.
Ring of the Skillful.notes: The ring grants a +1 bonus to a single skill, chosen at creation. The bonus does not affect attack rolls or rolls to activate powers.

Robe of Blending.name: Robe of Blending
Robe of Blending.description:
Robe OF Blending

Once per day, this simple wool robe grants its wearer major disguise with the Size modifier. The user also gains the ability to speak and understand the basic racial languages of the chosen form.

Price: 8,400 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{Disguise}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{Speak Language}; 4,200 gp.

Robe of Bone.name: Robe of Bone
Robe of Bone.description:
Robe OF Bone

When worn by a character who can cast the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{Zombie} power, she sees small, undead figures embroidered in this robe's otherwise unremarkable fabric. The wearer can detach one figure per round, tossing it to the ground so that it rises into an actual undead creature. The robe doesn’t grant control of the being, but the wearer may spend one Power Point per creature to do so (no roll is required). The Power Points cannot be recovered until the creature is destroyed.

A newly created robe of bones has two embroidered figures of each of the following undead:

  • Human skeleton
  • Wolf skeleton
  • Heavy horse skeleton
  • Goblin zombie
  • Human zombie
  • Ogre zombie

Cost: 2,400 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{Zombie}; 1,200 gp.

Robe of Scintillating Colors.name: Robe of Scintillating Colors
Robe of Scintillating Colors.description:
Robe OF scintillating colors

On command, this colorful robe illuminates a 5” (10 yard) radius centered on the wearer. Up to ten times per day, the user can speak the command word to cast a minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{Stun} on a single target up to 10” (20 yards) distant. The wearer of this robe benefits from minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{Deflection} (ranged).

Price: 27,000 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{Deflection},@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{Stun}; 13,500 gp.

Robe of Useful Items.name: Robe of Useful Items
Robe of Useful Items.description:
Robe OF Useful Items

A character who dons this simple robe notes it’s adorned with small cloth patches of various shapes. Only the wearer can see these patches, recognize them for what items they become, and detach them.

One patch can be detached each round as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Limited Free Actions}. Doing so causes it to become an actual item as indicated below.

A newly created robe of useful items always has two each of the following patches:

  • Dagger
  • Bullseye lantern (full and lit)
  • Mirror (a polished 2×4-foot steel mirror)
  • Pole (12-foot length)
  • Hempen rope (50-foot coil)
  • Sack

In addition, the robe has several other patches. Roll 4d4 for the number of other patches and then roll d12 for each on the table below to determine its nature.

Useful Items
d12 Result
1 Bag of 100 gold pieces
2 Door, iron (up to 10 ft. wide and 10 ft. high and barred on one side— must be placed upright, attaches and hinges itself)
3 Gems, 10 (100 gp value each)
4 Ladder, wooden (24 ft. long)
5 Mule (with saddle bags)
6 Pit, open (12 ft. by 12 ft. by 12 ft.)
7 Potion of major healing
8 Rowboat (12 ft. long)
9 Minor scroll of one randomly determined spell
10 War dogs, pair (treat as dogs)
11 Window (2 ft. by 4 ft., up to 2 ft. deep)
12 Portable ram

Price: 7,000 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{Conjure Item}; 3,500 gp.

Rod of Absorption.name: Rod of Absorption
Rod of Absorption.description:
Rod of Absorption

This rod absorbs spells or spell-like abilities into itself. The magic absorbed must be a single-target spell directed at either the character holding the rod or her gear. The rod then nullifies the spell’s effect and stores however many Power Points were actually used to cast it (so absorbing a power shorted for all its @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Power Points} has no benefit).

Absorption requires no action on the part of the user, and she can use stored Power Points as she wishes thereafter

A rod of absorption absorbs a maximum of 50 Power Points. The rod cannot be recharged by other means.

The wielder always knows the rod’s remaining absorbing potential and current amount of stored energy.

Price: 50,000 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{Dispel}; 25,000 gp.

Rod of Metamagic.name: Rod of Metamagic
Rod of Metamagic.description:
Rod of Metamagic

The wielder of this rod can reduce the cost of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers} on a spell he casts by 1. This can be done once per day with a minor enchantment or three times per day if major.

Price: 9,000 gp (minor), 32,000 (major); Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: 4,500 gp (minor), 16,000 gp (major).

Rod of Negation.name: Rod of Negation
Rod of Negation.description:
Rod of Metamagic

A rod of negation prevents most magic items from functioning for 5 rounds. The ray is cast with a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Spellcasting]{Arcane skill} roll (user’s choice). The roll ignores all external penalties (the item’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{size}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{cover}, , @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination}, etc.) but the target device must be visible.

The rod can also negate an enemy item’s instantaneous effects. To do so, the rod wielder must be on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Hold} and successfully interrupt the foe. If so, the rival power is automatically negated.

The rod can function three times per day.

Price: 37,000 gp;

Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{Dispel}; 18,500 gp.

Rod of Rulership.name: Rod of Rulership
Rod of Rulership.description:
ROD OF RULERSHIP

Usually crafted as a royal scepter of great material worth and fine craftsmanship, this rod grants the user the ability to command and coordinate up to 100 creatures within a 200-yard radius. When held, the user gains +4 to all @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} rolls, as well as the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Command]{Command} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Natural Leader]{Natural Leader} Edges (each with a 200 yard Command Radius).

The user can activate the rod at will, but it functions for a total of only 500 minutes of usage before it crumbles to dust.

Price: 60,000 gp; Weight: 8 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Puppet]{Puppet}; 32,500 gp.

Rod of Wonder.name: Rod of Wonder
Rod of Wonder.description:
ROD OF Wonder

A rod of wonder is a strange and unpredictable device that randomly generates any number of weird effects each time it is used. Typical powers of the rod are listed on the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-tables.Rod of Wonder Activation]{Rod of Wonder Activation} table. Unless noted otherwise, the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} for any of the effects is 5.

Use this device only in the most dire circumstances— it’s as likely to empower a foe as to vanquish him!

Rod of Wonder Activation Table
D20 Wondrous Effect
1 Minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sloth/Speed]{slow} on target.
2 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Growth/Shrink]{Growth} on target (+2 Size).
3 600 butterflies pour forth and flutter around for two rounds, blinding everyone within 5” (10 yards).
4 The rod deludes the wielder for one round into believing it functions as indicated by a second die roll.
5 The wielder’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} is reduced by two for one day.
6 Heavy rain falls for 1 round in 10” (20 yard) radius, centered on the wielder
7 The wielder gains major @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{Invisibility} .The effect vanishes if he takes an action that causes damage to others.
8 Leaves grow from the target’s limbs, lasting 24 hours.
9 The wielder or a random target turns blue, green, or purple. Permanently.
10 A magical explosion detonates in a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Small Blast Template} for 3d6 damage, centered on whatever the user targeted.
11 Grass grows in 160-square-ft. area centered on the target of the rod. Foliage that already existed in the area grows to 10 times normal size.
12 A patch of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{Darkness} in a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Large Blast Template} appears over the target.
13 The wielder learns the target’s surface thoughts (as with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Reading]{Mind Reading} ) for 1d4 rounds. This can’t be resisted.
14 Dancing lights surround the target, negating any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination} penalties.
15 The target becomes @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Ethereal]{Ethereal} for 5 rounds.
16 A 3d6 lightning @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt} strikes the target!
17 The rod summons forth a wild animal. Roll 1d6: 1–2 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Bear]{Bear}, 3–4 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Lion]{Lion}, 5–6 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Cat, Small]{cat} (or any other animal of the GM's choice, including those in the Savage Pathfinder Bestiary).
18 Shimmering colors dance and play over a 40-ft square area directly in front of the rod. Any creature within is blinded. Those affected get a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action} to shake off the effects with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor }roll at –2 at the start of their turn.
19 1d4x10 gems (1 gp each) shoot forward in a stream. Half hit the target, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{distracting} him.
20 The target turns to stone (or flesh if stone already), unless it makes a Vigor roll at –2.

Craft: All listed powers; 41,000 gp

Price: 12,000 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Confusion]{Confusion}; 6,000 gp.

Rod of the Python.name: Rod of the Python
Rod of the Python.description:
Rod of the Python

One end of this rod curls and twists back on itself like a crook, and is often tipped with a snake or serpentine head. The rod is four feet long and causes Str+d6+1 damage in combat.

If the user throws the rod to the ground (as an action), it transforms into a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Snake, Constrictor]{Constrictor} and may act immediately. The python obeys all commands of the owner, and returns to rod form whenever the wielder desires, or whenever it moves further than 20” (40 yards) from the owner.

If the “snake” is slain, it returns to rod form and cannot be activated again for three days. A rod of the python only functions if the possessor is good.

Price: 13,000 gp; Weight: 10 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Baleful Polymorph]{Baleful Polymorph}; 6,500 gp.

Rope of Climbing.name: Rope of Climbing
Rope of Climbing.description:
ROPE OF climbing

This strange, magical 20-yard rope is no thicker than a wand but strong enough to support 3,000 lbs. When held and commanded, it snakes its way forward, fastening itself securely wherever the user wants at Pace 3. It can unfasten and return upon command as well.

The rope may also negate situational penalties to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (climbing) rolls where its magical properties can benefit the user (GM’s call).

Price: 3,000 gp; Weight: 3 lbs.

Craft: 1,500 gp.

Rope of Entanglement.name: Rope of Entanglement
Rope of Entanglement.description:
Rope OF entanglement

This 10-yard long coil of rope looks completely ordinary. On command, however, it lashes out to half its length to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Entangle} a victim.

The rope grants its user the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Entangle]{Entangle} power, and is cast with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing).

The rope is destroyed if severed.

Price: 21,000 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Entangle]{Entangle}; and 10,500 gp.

Saddle, war (free reroll Riding).name: Saddle, war (free reroll Riding)
Saddle, war (free reroll Riding).description: Saddle, war (free reroll on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Riding} roll to stay in saddle)
Saddle, war (free reroll Riding).notes: Free reroll on Riding roll to stay in saddle

Scarab of Protection.name: Scarab of Protection
Scarab of Protection.description:
Scarab of Protection

This device is a silver medallion in the shape of a beetle. If it is held for one round, an inscription appears on its surface letting the holder know it’s a protective device.

When worn, it can absorb up 12 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Energy Drain]{Energy Drain} attacks (page 240). After that it turns to powder and is destroyed.

Price: 38,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{Arcane Protection}; 19,000 gp.

Scarab, Golembane.name: Scarab, Golembane
Scarab, Golembane.description:
Scarab, golembane

This beetle-shaped pin enables its wearer to detect any golem within 10” (20 yards), although he must concentrate in order for the detection to take place (as an action).

It enables its possessor to ignore up to 4 points of any golem’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armor000000000]{Armor} when attacking with weapons, unarmed attacks, or natural weapons.

Price: 2,500 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{Detect Arcana}; 1,250 gp.

Scroll of Blast.name: Scroll of Blast
Scroll of Blast.description:
See power: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{Blast}

Scrolls contain magical words, runes, and glyphs a user can activate by reading them aloud.

Each scroll has one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000001]{power} inscribed onto it, including possible @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers} if listed in its description. A character must have the scroll in hand and may not read more than one scroll per turn.

Reading a scroll is an action and requires a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} roll or arcane skill roll (caster’s choice). If the roll is successful, the power activates and the scroll fades. A reader may try again if the rolls fails, but a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure} means the scroll crumbles to dust without activating the power.

Craft: The cost of a scroll is equal to its @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000001]{power’s} Rank × the number of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points}Power Points} it uses; then multiply that total by 50 gp. A scroll of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{bolt} with AP 2, for example, is Novice (1) × 2 Power Points, × 50 gp = 100 gp. A scroll's market price is double its cost to craft
Scroll of Blast.notes: 2d6 damage to MBT, 3d6 on a raise.

Scroll of Blind.name: Scroll of Blind
Scroll of Blind.description:
See power: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blind]{Blind}

Scrolls contain magical words, runes, and glyphs a user can activate by reading them aloud.

Each scroll has one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000001]{power} inscribed onto it, including possible @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers} if listed in its description. A character must have the scroll in hand and may not read more than one scroll per turn.

Reading a scroll is an action and requires a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} roll or arcane skill roll (caster’s choice).
